update.description:
When URI to a mesh cannot be found, Bullet crashes because some objects are NULL.
This PR fixes it by adding ``nullptr`` checks and just skipping mesh shapes which could not be loaded from file.
update.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

pull_request.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

pullrequest.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

content.raw:
The new test (loading from the world file) does internally call `World::LoadModel` which is the function I basically want to test. So both tests do cover the same, as the other version also uses `World::LoadModel`. What I meant is that in case either adding via insertions or loading a world file changes the way they add models at some point, they could behave differently. At the moment however  they are the same, and I guess it's very likely to stay this way too... so I reckon it would be OK to remove the initial version of the test.

I'm using the `insertion` way to add a model so that's what I wanted to test. That's the reason why the first version of the test is like it is.

Does that make sense?
content.html:
The new test (loading from the world file) does internally call World::LoadModel which is the function I basically want to test. So both tests do cover the same, as the other version also uses World::LoadModel. What I meant is that in case either adding via insertions or loading a world file changes the way they add models at some point, they could behave differently. At the moment however they are the same, and I guess it's very likely to stay this way too... so I reckon it would be OK to remove the initial version of the test.

I'm using the insertion way to add a model so that's what I wanted to test. That's the reason why the first version of the test is like it is.

Does that make sense?

pull_request.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

pullrequest.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

content.raw:
Yeah I know this is a weird way to do it... using the `<insertion>` tag and adding the model via the world state is a bit of an unintuitive way to add a model, because `World::LoadModel` is unfortunately private.

It is also possible to use a world file. I've just done it this way to make sure the model loading was tested in one step of the test.

I've added a second test which uses the world file instead. The same issue happens and is fixed by this PR. Should we just keep that one and delete the first version?

‌
content.html:
Yeah I know this is a weird way to do it... using the <insertion> tag and adding the model via the world state is a bit of an unintuitive way to add a model, because World::LoadModel is unfortunately private.

It is also possible to use a world file. I've just done it this way to make sure the model loading was tested in one step of the test.

I've added a second test which uses the world file instead. The same issue happens and is fixed by this PR. Should we just keep that one and delete the first version?

‌

pullrequest.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

content.raw:
Oh no, I didn't realise that, my bad! Obviously bad place for the test to go then. I've moved it to a new test `InvalidMeshInsertion` in `factory.cc`. 

Good idea about the `SpawnTrimesh` function, though it does actually wait until the model has been loaded (see [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ebef2bfd603d4246b0a59b16f0c1374abe19490f/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ServerFixture.cc-1630)), and when we use an invalid mesh, it is not guaranteed that the model will actually added, or is it? Though in practise it is (with an empty mesh), because `World::LoadModel()` is always called from `World::SetState()`...  but in theory it could be that this changes some time later on, and no model is added, or am I wrong?

If the insertion via a setting the world state is not such a great idea, it would of course be possible to use factory messages as well. Maybe the test can wait for a few seconds and make sure it doesn't crash while the model is being added?
content.html:
Oh no, I didn't realise that, my bad! Obviously bad place for the test to go then. I've moved it to a new test InvalidMeshInsertion in factory.cc.

Good idea about the SpawnTrimesh function, though it does actually wait until the model has been loaded (see here), and when we use an invalid mesh, it is not guaranteed that the model will actually added, or is it? Though in practise it is (with an empty mesh), because World::LoadModel() is always called from World::SetState()... but in theory it could be that this changes some time later on, and no model is added, or am I wrong?

If the insertion via a setting the world state is not such a great idea, it would of course be possible to use factory messages as well. Maybe the test can wait for a few seconds and make sure it doesn't crash while the model is being added?

pull_request.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

pullrequest.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

content.raw:
It could happen in physics.cc, but the test cases you've added to is a `TEST_F`, which only tests for ODE. It needs to be a `TEST_P` in order to test for each physics engine.

`test/integration/factory.cc` seems like a decent place for it. I think you could use the [SpawnTrimesh function](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ebef2bfd603d4246b0a59b16f0c1374abe19490f/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ServerFixture.cc-1596).
content.html:
It could happen in physics.cc, but the test cases you've added to is a TEST_F, which only tests for ODE. It needs to be a TEST_P in order to test for each physics engine.

test/integration/factory.cc seems like a decent place for it. I think you could use the SpawnTrimesh function.
